body_html: tensorflow-gpu is for computers with an NVidia GPU. See https://www.tensorflow.org/install/pip. Assuming you only have the Intel graphics adapter, you'll need to uninstall tensorflow-gpu and install tensorflow. This will run on your CPU. I don't believe there is formal OpenCL/Intel GPU acceleration support but you can google for info on this if you're curious.
body_text: tensorflow-gpu is for computers with an NVidia GPU.  See https://www.tensorflow.org/install/pip.  Assuming you only have the Intel graphics adapter, you'll need to uninstall tensorflow-gpu and install tensorflow.  This will run on your CPU.  I don't believe there is formal OpenCL/Intel GPU acceleration support but you can google for info on this if you're curious.
body: **tensorflow-gpu** is for computers with an NVidia GPU.  See https://www.tensorflow.org/install/pip.  Assuming you only have the Intel graphics adapter, you'll need to uninstall **tensorflow-gpu** and install **tensorflow**.  This will run on your CPU.  I don't believe there is formal OpenCL/Intel GPU acceleration support but you can google for info on this if you're curious.
